column4: i try to chroot direectory and i get "chroot: cannot change root directory to edit: No such file or directory", what to do
chroot: cannot run command `/bin/bash': No such file or directory
you'll get that if there is no /<dir you chroot to>/bin/bash
it exists, i try to chroot /mnt and exists, i am running from live CD, try to repair grub
That is odd, maybe you really dont have bash in there? Have you tried /bin/sh?
doesent wotk, and both exists in /bin, bash and sh
i am doing this: http://grub.enbug.org/Grub2LiveCdInstallGuide  commands on the bottom
but cant do step 4 because of that

I find it odd that its not working for you. Other things that can give you hassles is there are permission errors, or you're using a Live CD that is 32bit when your system is 64bit (or vice versa)--but those would give different errors than you've posted
maybe  thats it, i am having 32bit cd and 64bit system
but yeah, you'll definately need the same Live CD as your system. It MIGHT work if your Live CD was 64-bit and your system is 32-bit... but I've never tried it.
ook, will be back if something wont work, tnx
